com.google.wave.api
Class Wavelet

java.lang.Object
  com.google.wave.api.Wavelet

public class Wavelet
extends java.lang.Object

A class that models a single wavelet instance. A single wavelet is composed of metadata, for example, id,creator, creation time, last modified time, title. A wavelet is also composed of a set of participants, a set of tags, a list of blips, and a data document, which is a map of key-value pairs of data.

Returns:

proxyFor

public Wavelet proxyFor(java.lang.String proxyForId)
Returns a view of this wavelet that will proxy for the specified id. A shallow copy of the current wavelet is returned with the proxyingFor field set. Any modifications made to this copy will be done using the proxyForId, i.e. the robot+<proxyForId>@appspot.com address will be used.

Parameters:
proxyForId - the id to proxy.
Returns:
a shallow copy of this wavelet with the proxying information set.

submitWith

public void submitWith(Wavelet other)
Submit this wavelet when the given other wavelet is submitted. Wavelets constructed outside of the event callback need to be either explicitly submitted using AbstractRobot.submit(Wavelet) or be associated with a different wavelet that will be submitted or is part of the event callback.

Parameters:
other - the other wavelet whose operation queue will be joined with.

reply

public Blip reply(java.lang.String initialContent)
Replies to the conversation in this wavelet.

Parameters:
initialContent - the initial content of the reply.
Returns:
an instance of Blip that represents a transient version of the reply.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if initialContent does not start with a newline character.

                                  java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Blip> blips,

Parameters:
